class.name: LuaCallableExtra
class.description: This is a simple wrapper class to let LuaAPI know you want a little extra info. It is used to request references to the LuaAPI object as an argument and specifie your last argument is a tuple.

members.member: Whether or not the last argument is a tuple.
Whether or not the function wants a reference to the LuaAPI object.
The TOTAL number of arguments excluding the tuple if there is one.

method.name: with_tuple
method.description: Call the function with a tuple as the last argument. Argc is the TOTAL number of arguments excluding the tuple.

method.name: with_ref
method.description: Call the function with a reference to the LuaAPI object as the first argument.

method.name: with_ref_and_tuple
method.description: Call the function with a reference to the LuaAPI object as the first argument and a tuple as the last argument. Argc is the TOTAL number of arguments excluding the tuple.
